-AUTER BACH
IMPORTANI NOTES
The following are the instructions for emergency evacuation procedures used at
the La Guardia stewardess emergency evacuation meetings December 16,
the La Guardia st nards a entry evacuation sot that Douby 22o them 10
time to time.
INSTRUCTIONS TO ISSENGERS
1. LADIES AND GENTLEMEN:
I have something very important to
say to you, so
please listen carefully to everything I say,
and do exactly what I tell you.
We are going to make an emergency landing at
in 10 minutes, so we
will have to act quickly.
Straighten up your seat backs. Remove your eye
glasses and any sharp objects such as
pens and pencils,
from your pockets
and remove your high heeled shoes.
Place these in the seat pocket in front
Passengers in aisle seats reach above you and take down blankets and
pillows to
your seat belts and keep them fastened
will be two impacts, the first when "e hit the ground; the second when the
plane stops its forward movement.
It is important,
renember,
keep your seat
belts fastened until you fcel the second impact and the plane has stopped.
After the plane stops,
unfasten your belts and go to the nearest exit.
Beside
the main cabin door, there
are exits here and here (point to these exits-
change this according to where you are standing and which cabin you are in).
If you go out over
sit down and slide off,
away from the
propellers and land on your feet.
of the way as far fron the plane as possible.
one of the win Holp others if you can, otherwise got out
INSTRUCTIONS TO MEN DELEGATED TO HELE
A. Pick two men for each exit and move them quickly to these exits.
Instruct
then all at once if possible and give instructions before windows ars opened.
When plane has stopped completcly, second
impact,
unfasten your belts.
Don't
unfasten them before that
because you
are important to the safe evacuation
of all these other people and we can't afford to have you injured. Then climb
out
on the wing,
one foot first,
last.
Stay at window exit on wing and help others out.
then hat n cho Toll that how to en
Pull other foot out
through window and see that they sit down and slide.
Keep them away from
propellers.
The second man out will slide off the wing and remain at the
edge to catch others as they slide off.
Any other men willing to help once
you are outside, please remain at these exit positions. Start a second line
sliding off cach wing.
Help people slide by giving them a gentle push and
help the man on the ground to catch people and get then out of the way quickly.
B.
Pick two (four if you have tine) men to sit close to the main cabin door. (I
would prefer to have one in 11D and one in 12B or on the
stewardess jump seat.
Two other good seats are 9B and C.
Keep 11C for the First Stewardess and
9B or C for Stewardess or 1B or C - depending upon the emergency.
Either of
these positions would place her where she could get outside quickly and be of
more assistance if necessary.)
The two nen closest to the door should go out first, down the slide, hand over
hand, etc, etc.
EINAL PREPARATION BEFORE LANDING
If time permits after these men are instructed, then get them to stow loose
